{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3554770,"name":"","username":"StarManTheGamer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a698b9/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T03:05:59.116Z","cooked":"

Hi all,

I know this is going to sound crazy, but our entire team is confused by our robot’s behavior. Every time we turn on our robot, the wheels stutter and start moving. Sometimes, it is rare but will happen, the robot will just start driving itself forward or backward, with no pattern. It occurs as soon as we turn on the power switch. We took our robot to Week 0 and the technicians were stumped as well, but also mad at us because we would set our robot on the field and it would start driving with no computer being connected.

Looking for some advice here. Is there something we should look for that would cause this behavior? We’re using tank drive this year with PlayingWithFusion Venom Motors. All of the can is connected via PlayingWithFusion CANstar 2-Drop. We’re using a CTRE PDP Board (First Generation).

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T03:05:59.116Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":46,"reads":715,"readers_count":714,"score":388.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3554803,"name":"Ezra","username":"Strflightmight","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strflightmight/{size}/261969_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T04:05:02.509Z","cooked":"

What happens when you try to turn on the robot without code? What about if you disconnect the CAN and keep the power intact? Try to experiment a bit. It might help you troubleshoot it, and if you still can’t figure it out, you can come back here with more information so we could help more.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T04:05:02.509Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":674,"readers_count":673,"score":134.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"Ezra","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62434,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 | Programmer, Electronics Lead, and Driver"},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/2","custom_user_title":"5990 | Programmer, Electronics Lead, and Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3554806,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T04:08:09.951Z","cooked":"

When you are testing, I strongly encourage putting the robot on blocks so it doesn’t run away.

I would try and look in your Robot.java file and see if there’s anything under disabledInit() or disabledPeriodic() that could make this happen. You can also check your commands to make sure none of them are able to be run while the robot is disabled.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T04:08:09.951Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":650,"readers_count":649,"score":190.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/3","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3554807,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T04:08:33.343Z","cooked":"

Also, if you would be able to share your code, that would be very helpful for people trying to help debug.

github.com

Code for the 2025 Reefscape Season - Minneapolis Regionals

Please do note that it truly isn’t my greatest work. I’m currently the only programmer and technician on the team so I’ve had to juggle a lot recently.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T04:16:40.594Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":555,"readers_count":554,"score":131.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Trojan-Robotics-3871/2025_Comp_Robot_Code","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - Trojan-Robotics-3871/2025_Comp_Robot_Code: Code for the 2025 Reefscape Season - Minneapolis Regionals","clicks":30}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63767,"username":"Sam948","name":"Sam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3554811,"name":"Kabir","username":"kn4","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kn4/{size}/235296_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T04:17:42.581Z","cooked":"
StarManTheGamer:

it would start driving with no computer being connected.

In this case, I would more strongly suspect an electrical issue over a programming issue, since the rio shouldn’t allow motors to be enabled while no driver station is connected, but just to be sure, you could try deploying an empty robot project to the rio and seeing if this behavior still occurs.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T04:17:42.581Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":522,"readers_count":521,"score":274.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"Kabir","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57470,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2724 programmer"},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/6","custom_user_title":"2724 programmer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3554977,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T13:28:07.090Z","cooked":"

There is a recent CD thread about wiring a SparkMax backwards - power in flipped with power to motor circuit - and that ran immediately. Maybe you have something similar.

Another possibility is you wired the controller to PWM (in addition to your CAN wiring) instead of using the CAN as you expected through software and the controller’s PWM isn’t zeroed well enough so it interprets the PWM signal not as zero.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T13:28:07.090Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":475,"readers_count":474,"score":110.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3555003,"name":"Christopher149","username":"Christopher149","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T14:20:10.426Z","cooked":"
StarManTheGamer:

driving with no computer being connected

The last time something like this happened to us was 2012, one of our Jaguar motor controllers failed such that after we e-stopped, it was still driving its motor (it was in the drivetrain so the robot was turning in place) while smoking and making a stink.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T14:20:10.426Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":425,"readers_count":424,"score":90.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"Christopher149","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14984,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/8","custom_user_title":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3555013,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T14:32:13.697Z","cooked":"
StarManTheGamer:

mad at us because we would set our robot on the field and it would start driving with no computer being connected.

To be clear, a robot with no positive connection to the driver station, but which is validly wired should

  1. Not put any power to any motor
  2. Not require any team code to accomplish that behavior

IE - as long as things are wired right, this is beyond your control. If you haven’t yet, I’d definitely recommend reaching out to PwF’s product support.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T14:32:13.697Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":391,"readers_count":390,"score":118.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3555238,"name":"Jared Leonard","username":"JaredL","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredl/{size}/240552_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T17:13:21.423Z","cooked":"

I’m not at my bench and can’t confirm at the moment, but this block of code looks suspect:

Rather than commanding your rear motors to follow the fronts, try telling all four to stop by calling set(0) for each. Like this:

I would suspect that this is likely the issue OP.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T18:55:29.365Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":309,"readers_count":308,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":42432,"username":"JaredL","name":"Jared Leonard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredl/{size}/240552_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/11","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3558908,"name":"","username":"StarManTheGamer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a698b9/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T02:33:58.579Z","cooked":"

Hi Jared,

We did this change a few days ago and have been continuing our progress throughout the past few days, however we’re still having the issue with our robot driving itself. Any other advice or recommendations?

Thanks

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T02:33:58.579Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":291,"readers_count":290,"score":58.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":42432,"username":"JaredL","name":"Jared Leonard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredl/{size}/240552_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3559011,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T06:13:46.887Z","cooked":"

I’d strongly suspect a CAN wiring issue over a code issue. As others have indicated: FRC compliance demands CAN motor controllers will not run unless receiving an enabled signal from the RIO. Similarly, the RIO does not output PWM when disabled because that would drive motors.

However, the Rio does put out CAN when disabled; If your can network is not properly terminated, wired backwards, or otherwise screwed up somehow, the CAN signal might be so degraded it’s getting interpreted as PWM, causing the motor to actuate.

Looking at the PWF documentation, it seems to detect PWM mode by checking if Yellow and Green are wired together. Since you appear to be running PWM mode at random, this helpfully indicates that the likely issue is an intermittent short somewhere in your CAN bus, triggering the Venom to run a non-PWM signal as a PWM signal, violating normal safety lockouts.
Being intermittent implies it’s probably due to a stray wire from a bad crimp, although metal shavings on a circuit board or open connection are always a suspect.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-17T06:13:46.887Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":281,"readers_count":280,"score":146.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/13","custom_user_title":"2811 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3559272,"name":"Jared Leonard","username":"JaredL","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredl/{size}/240552_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T14:59:41.230Z","cooked":"

Put your robot up on blocks and secure it so that there is no risk of movement. Can you see the LEDs on the back of the motors? The blinking pattern will tell us definitively if the motors think they are in PWM or CAN mode.

{B2EF53DC-C950-49D0-AB40-028B94622B56}695×103 17.6 KB

If you see two short green pulses followed by a long pulse, the motors detected at least one CAN message and are in CAN mode. Once the motors are in CAN mode the can’t switch back to PWM unless they are power cycled or the battery is low enough that they brown out.

If you see one short green pulse followed by a long green pulse, the motors are in PWM mode as @tekdemo and others have suggested.

Hi Jared,

I would say you led me in the right direction here. When we turn our robot on, for a few seconds it does the PWM flash and attempts to drive. After a few seconds, it starts blinking red red green green, which I would assume means it’s not connected and enabled. Once we turn on our drive station, they turn to a steady green color.

My question is, I’m not sure where to go from here now. The can is in perfect shape - at least from my diagnosis.

I’m going to attach some photos so you can see what we’re doing. The can starts from the roborio and then connects to the CANStar 2-drop that you guys offer. We have multiple around the robot. The one that the roborio connects to is attached to the REV Spark Max that we use for our coral motor and one of the venom motors. Then we continue to another one, attach another venom motor, loop around the robot, etc.

The only thing that happens that is different is that the can gets to the last CANStar 2-drop and then goes to our REV Pneumatics, and then that can go to our PDP Board.

IMG_30631920×2560 565 KB

Are those CAN Drops secured with sticky back tape to the frame? I’m not certain how pointy the solder is on those boards, but we’ve had fairly rounded solder connections punch through double side tape before and short to metal. You might try pulling those off the frame for testing, and see if the issue goes away.

Had another thought…

Venom detects PWM mode when it sees 1.5ms pulses on the CAN lines. The RoboRIO doesn’t do this (I’ve been trying to reproduce this issue since last week), but its possible one of your other CAN devices is. Could you try disconnecting your SparkMax and pneumatic hub from CAN and seeing if the problem is still present. If disconnecting those other devices fixes the problem that will help me prove what’s going on.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-19T15:15:02.754Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":154,"readers_count":153,"score":45.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"Jared Leonard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":42432,"username":"JaredL","name":"Jared Leonard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredl/{size}/240552_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42432,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Playing With Fusion, Inc. "},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/18","custom_user_title":"Playing With Fusion, Inc. ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3561877,"name":"Ben Edwards","username":"beedward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beedward/{size}/111315_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T16:43:57.915Z","cooked":"

No FRC compatible CAN device should put a 1.5 millisecond pulse on the CAN lines. The CAN standard allows devices to send no more than 11 dominant bits in a row (and that only for certain error cases). FRC CAN runs at 1 Mbit/sec so each bit time is 1 microsecond, so you’re looking at 11 microseconds max.

However, if the CAN bus is weakly terminated and/or if CANH or CANL is open somewhere, there can be filtering effects that would make a group of short pulses look like one longer pulse.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2025-03-19T16:43:57.915Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":18,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":144,"readers_count":143,"score":43.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495246,"topic_slug":"robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on","display_username":"Ben Edwards","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":42432,"username":"JaredL","name":"Jared Leonard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredl/{size}/240552_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37435,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"EE mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robot-drives-itself-immediately-when-turning-it-on/495246/19","custom_user_title":"EE mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3574462,"name":"","username":"StarManTheGamer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a698b9/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-31T01:13:49.520Z","cooked":"

Hey Jared,

Sorry for the late reply - It’s been a busy couple of days. We tried everything that was suggested, including checking our SparkMax and Pneumatics and seeing if that was the issue. The robot still seemed to enter PWM mode even with that, which I assumed was going to happen.

The Venoms are also running the latest firmware, as I checked that immediately when we got to robotics. The packages are all up-to-date as well as the Spark Max’s all being up-to-date. Our PDP board is also up-to-date.

I did like what tekdemo mentioned about checking my CAN Drops and how we have them secured! We have them secured to the frame, and they are pointy. We’re using two tapes on top of each other to secure them, but I think that could pose an issue, so we’re going to try replacing the tape and making some changes on Monday. I honestly didn’t think of that, so kudos to them.

We leave for our regional competition on Wednesday, which goes through Saturday. If we don’t find the issue, we’re just going to have to wing it. Our entire robot is entirely functional as we’ve worked every day on it to make sure it’s in the best working condition. Quite literally, at the moment, our only issue is that the robot sometimes moves upon starting it.
